str2: Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From skandalon; to entrap, i.e. Trip up (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
